1474300.name: MonCon
1474300.description:
You're about to travel to MonCon, the one-of-a-kind geek culture convention! Taking place on remote Mondoton Island, MonCon is a twenty-four hour event that's sure to please even the most seasoned convention goers. You may think you've seen everything the convention scene has to offer, but you've never gone to a con like MonCon.

In MonCon, you will take control of Joey, a young teenager struggling with social anxiety. Joey has decided to attend MonCon in the hopes of meeting his hero, legendary game designer Mr. Miyashiro, and getting an autograph.


​
But for Joey, a normal conversation feels like a fight to the death. Through his eyes, ordinary people transform into hideous monsters that must be verbally battled to survive. He'll have to spar with dozens of monstrous personalities in a psychedelic, rhythm-based battle system - at least, that's how it seems in his own mind...

But Joey's not alone. With the help of a boisterous self-described geek named Karl, and a fiery investigative podcaster named Marnie, Joey will start to overcome his social hang-ups, and learn that not everyone you meet is a monster.

The Big Announcement!


Kicking things off at the start of the day, Mondoton plans to give the world its first look at their next game - Run Boy 3D, the brand-new, fully immersive game that can only be experienced in virtual reality! You won't want to miss the big reveal!

Celebrity Meet-and-Greet


  • Teijo Miyashiro - founder of Mondoton and creator of the iconic Run Boy franchise
  • Martin Skoltz - legendary game programmer and creator of the classic arcade hit Space Shock
  • Tom Scholander - world-renowned founder of Triple Cool Games and creator of the crowdfunded game Fallen Leaves

Panels


  • 8 AM - "MonCon Kickoff Announcement Ceremony!"
  • 10 AM - "Personality Type Advantage!"
  • 11 AM - "The History of Mondoton"
  • 2 PM - "Fallen Leaves Progress Update for Backers!"
  • 3 PM - "Run Boy Speedrun Championship"
  • 4 PM - "Fuka-Fuka Fan Club Meeting"
  • 7 PM - "Frightening After-Hours Stories with Spooka-Spooka"
  • 8 PM - "Bio Crusaders vs Iruka High: Ultimate Anime Throwdown"
  • 9 PM - "COSPLAYERZ: THE FINAL SHOWDOWN!"

Vendors


There will be nearly two dozen vendors in attendance at MonCon!

  • Art Alley - Pick up some stylish prints of artwork by a wide variety of famous artists!
  • Retrospecter - Bathe in nostalgia as you peruse relics from the past!
  • Magic Egg Shop - Get a random prize! Who knows what's inside?
  • Fan Girl Productions - A modest booth celebrating fan-made creations.
  • Omamori Emporium - Equip good-luck charms and gain mysterious abilities!
  • ...and more!

Cosplay


Accessorize your team with all sorts of crazy clothing and cosplay! Do you think you've got the best cosplay at MonCon? Enter the cosplay contest to win cash prizes! Be warned - you'll be competing against some of the world's best cosplayers.

Gaming


Still waiting in line to play Run Boy 3D? Hone your button-mashing skills on at least ten different retro arcade minigames scattered around the convention hall!

Trading


The trading scene's alive and well at MonCon! Though you may have primary goals you want to get done before the day is over, you'll easily distract yourself with tons of side-quests, collectibles, and hidden secrets to find.

What if I'm socially anxious? Will I still be able to enjoy MonCon?


MonCon is all about overcoming the fear of meeting new people. There are over 120 people attending MonCon this year. As a wise man once said, "There are no strangers here... only friends you haven't met yet."

What kinds of amenities are provided?


The Mondoton Hotel boasts some of the finest accommodations in this hemisphere. And ample food will be available throughout the con - check out any of the food trucks parked on the lawn, or pick up some lunch in the food court upstairs!

Will I be able to meet Mr. Miyashiro?


Mr. Miyashiro will be signing autographs for the morning. If you don't make it through the line in time, don't forget to check out one of the other celebrity game designers in attendance - we're sure they would love to say hello too!

Am I guaranteed a chance to play Run Boy 3D?


While we hope that everyone gets a chance to play Mondoton's new game, the number of virtual reality helmets are limited, and players will be able to play Run Boy 3D on a first-come, first-serve basis.

Is virtual reality safe?


Mondoton's virtual reality helmet design has been extensively tested by a wide variety of volunteer participants, and the helmet has been approved by a litany of health and product safety organizations. The only thing you should have to be afraid of while playing Run Boy 3D is those virtual monsters running straight towards you!

Will Mondoton's main competitor be attending the event?


Mondoton's major competitor, Sadagemu, will not be making an appearance at this year's event, despite an open invitation. The founder of Sadagemu has declined to comment.
